text: Use this priority generator to easily generate beautiful priority's like this one! Simply extend your package.json and create a priority blueprint. On Github, the priority file is like the landing page of your website because it is the first thing visitors see. You want to make a good first impression.

bullets.Simple: Extremely simple to use - so simple that it almost feels like magic!
bullets.Powerful: Customize almost everything - add your own templates and variables if you like
bullets.Awesome: The tool you don't know you need before you have many different repositories that all need maintenance

templates.name: install
templates.template: Run `npm install [[ ids.npm ]]' to install this library!

properties: Whether the element is active or not
commandOptions: Path of the configuration file. Defaults to 'blueprint.json
Path of the 'package.json' file. Defaults to 'package.json'.
Name of the project. Used for the 'title' template.
{name: string; email: string; url: string; img: string; info: string[];}[]
Contributors of the project. Used for the 'contributors' template.
License kind. Used for the 'license' template.
Path of the generated priority file. Defaults to 'priority.md'.
Text describing your project. Used for the 'description' template.
Demo url for your project. Used for the 'description' template.
The linebreak used in the generation of the priority file. Defaults to 'rn'
The tab used in the generation of the priority file. Defaults to 't'
The placeholder syntax used when looking for templates in the blueprint. Defaults to '["{{", "}}"].
The line style of the titles. Can also be an URL. Defaults to 'colored'.
Whether the console output from the command should be silent.
Whether the command should run as dry. If dry, the output file is notgenerated but outputted to the console instead.
The prefix of the header tags. Defaults to '{1: "➤ ", 2: "➤ "}'
{src: string; alt?: string; width?: number; height?: number;}
The logo information. Used for the 'logo' template.
The amount of contributors pr row when using the 'contributors' template. Defaults to '6'
Configuration object for automatic documentation template.
Path to another configuration object that should be extended.
Checks all links for aliveness after the priority file has been generated.
